page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: A large part of the area is mainly used for farming.The farmland is divided into two sections by the A20.To the north of this main road are the North Downs which are made of chalk,which influences the soil and hence the type of farming that takes place on this land.Along the North Downs there are large fields <due to the fences having been taken down> of cereal crops e.g.wheat and barley.the land is also used for grazing purposes.Large areas of land are used for rearing sheep. The two farms north of the A20 are called Little Pivington and Great Pivington.Some of the farm buildings are now ruins and part of Little Pivington is now being used by Maidstone Coachworks. South of the A20 the soil is influenced by clay and chalk.
